intro: Adicea sanctae-crucis, commonly known as the Crucifixion Plant, is a rare and unique species native to the Canary Islands. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae, characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers that resemble a crucifix. The plant features smooth, dark green leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the island's Mediterranean climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
